channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Japan stocks rebound more than 10% after historic losses; other Asia markets also recover
item.description: The rebound follows a sharp sell-off in the U.S. with the Dow and the S&P 500 notching their worst sessions since September 2022.

item.title: $1 trillion wipeout: Market rout punishes megacap tech
item.description: The seven most-valuable U.S. tech companies lost a combined $1 trillion in market value at the start of trading on Monday.

item.title: UNESCO uses emergency procedure to name Gaza site to both its ‘World Heritage’ and ‘In Danger’ lists
item.description: The decision to inscribe the Saint Hilarion Monastery/Tell Umm Amer to both lists reflects the site's inherent value and need for protection, UNESCO said.

item.title: San Francisco Fed President Daly sees interest rate cuts coming as labor market weakens
item.description: Progress on inflation and a clear slowdown in hiring likely will drive the Fed to some extent of policy easing, Daly said Monday.

item.title: OpenAI co-founder John Schulman says he will leave and join rival Anthropic
item.description: Schulman said OpenAI executives remain committed to backing efforts to ensure that people can control highly capable artificial intelligence models.

item.title: Google loses antitrust case over search
item.description: Google has illegally held a monopoly in search and text advertising, a federal judge ruled on Monday

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Dow sheds 1,000 points
item.description: S&P 500 posts worst day since 2022 in global market sell-off. Google loses antitrust case. Bitcoin tumbles

item.title: No passports needed: Singapore launches biometric immigration processing at Changi Airport
item.description: Singapore launches trials for travelers to clear immigration at Changi Airport using biometric data in lieu of passport checks.

item.title: U.S. crude oil falls to six-month low as market sells off on recession fears
item.description: Weak economic data in the U.S. sparked a sell-off in equity markets as fears grow that a recession may be looming.

item.title: UBS says 'going into Japan now is like catching a falling knife,' warns stock sell-off will continue
item.description: The Nikkei 225 and the Topix extended their declines, falling past 7% on the day, and hovering close to bear market territory.

item.title: Investors are unwinding the biggest ‘carry trade’ the world has ever seen, SocGen strategist says
item.description: Carry trades refer to trades wherein an investor borrows in a currency with low interest rates and reinvests the proceeds in higher-yielding assets elsewhere.

item.title: Taiwan under pressure to bolster its defense as Trump-Harris presidential race stokes policy concerns
item.description: Experts say that Taiwan is under more pressure to build up its defense capabilities and deterrence in the face of uncertainty in the upcoming U.S. elections.

item.title: 'Never quit your job,' says early retiree and self-made multimillionaire: Do this instead
item.description: Financial Samurai founder Sam Dogen says you're better off financially negotiating a layoff rather than quitting if you're unhappy at work.

item.title: Ukraine finally sends F-16s into the battle against Russia — but they might not be a game-changer
item.description: It was a pivotal moment for Ukraine as it unveiled its first F-16 fighter jets on Sunday. The difference the aircraft will make in battle remains to be seen.

item.title: Elon Musk revives lawsuit against OpenAI, Sam Altman in federal court
item.description: Elon Musk has revived a lawsuit against Sam Altman in federal court, alleging that the Tesla boss was manipulated into co-founding OpenAI.

item.title: The Fed is trying to 'fight a ghost' as recession fears mount, investor says
item.description: The Federal Reserve may have little room for manoeuvre as a global market sell-off continues amid fears of a looming U.S. recession, investor Cole Smead warned.

item.title: U.S. expat who's lived in Italy, France and more: If you want to move to Europe, here's my best advice
item.description: Finding a new country to live in isn't as simple as going on vacation there, says U.S. expat Alex Ingrim.

item.title: SoftBank shares tank near 19%, wiping off $4.6 billion from founder Masayoshi Son's fortune
item.description: SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son's net worth fell by $4.6 billion on Monday, according to the Forbes real-time billionaires list.

item.title: Everyone is talking about the Sahm recession indicator. Here’s what you need to know
item.description: Investors have turned to one of the most time-tested indicators to determine whether the U.S. economy is in a recession.

item.title: Japan's Nikkei logs worst day since 1987 Black Monday crash
item.description: The 12.4% loss on the Nikkei was the worst day for the index since the "Black Monday" of 1987.

item.title: I'm prepared to 'start buying Japan,' Monex Group's Jesper Koll says despite major stock sell-off
item.description: Jesper Koll, head of Japan at Monex Group, says he is prepared to "start buying Japan" even as Japanese markets experienced a major stock-sell off on Monday.

item.title: Wharton's Jeremy Siegel says Fed needs to make an emergency rate cut
item.description: Wharton's Jeremey Siegel called on the Fed to make an emergency 75 basis-point cut in the federal funds rate after Friday's jobs report.

item.title: Crypto selloff wipes out $367 billion in value as bitcoin, ether plunge
item.description: Bitcoin and ethereum suffered steep drops on Sunday as investors sold out of risky assets.

item.title: A global stock sell-off is deepening with investors fleeing to safe havens
item.description: Investors are turning to safe-haven assets such as the U.S. Treasurys and Swiss franc, as the global stock sell-off deepens.

item.title: The end of the 'carry trade'? How Japan's yen could be ripping through U.S. stocks
item.description: The key driver of global markets is the yen exchange rate, according to one financial historian.

item.title: Summer is ‘high season’ for flight delays. Here’s what travelers need to know
item.description: Financial compensation for flight delay and cancelation varies by airline.

item.title: Retiring Corvette 'godfather' on EVs, spinoff and a performance SUV
item.description: The "godfather" of GM's modern day Corvettes Tadge Juechter retired Wednesday after roughly 47 years with the automaker, including 31 years devoted to Corvette.

item.title: 'Underconsumption core' is in — and not a moment too soon, I say
item.description: Underconsumption is not just a fad, it’s a movement that often goes hand in hand with the start of a economic slowdown.

item.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway sold nearly half its stake in Apple
item.description: Berkshire disclosed an $84.2 billion stake in Apple at the end of the second quarter, suggesting that Buffett offloaded more than 49% of the tech stake.

item.title: 'I love my black job': Simone Biles takes apparent swipe at Trump after winning Olympics gold
item.description: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump says immigrants are "taking Black jobs."
